value.title: Azure for the Data Engineer
value.excerpt: This learning path guides data engineers through the evolving benefits your organization gains with Azure cloud data platform technologies.

topItems.title: Understand the evolving world of data
topItems.excerpt: Discover how data systems and roles are evolving and explore the differences between on-premises and cloud data solutions using sample business cases.

topItems.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform
topItems.excerpt: Explore the broad array of Azure technologies that analyze text or images and relational, nonrelational, or streaming data.

topItems.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer, how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI roles, and explore common data engineering practices.

value.title: Align requirements with cloud types and service models in Azure
value.excerpt: Discover Azure's three approaches to deploying cloud resources -- public, private, and hybrid -- and learn the difference each makes in your Azure services.

value.title: Analyze costs and create budgets with Azure Cost Management
value.excerpt: Learn how to use cost analysis to understand how your costs accrue each month.

value.title: Analyze your Azure infrastructure by using Azure Monitor logs
value.excerpt: Use Azure Monitor logs to extract valuable information about your infrastructure from log data.

value.title: Control Azure services with the CLI
value.excerpt: Learn the steps to install the Azure CLI locally, create a website, and manage Azure resources using the CLI.

value.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
value.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer, how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI roles, and explore common data engineering practices.

value.title: Detect and analyze faces with the Face service
value.excerpt: Face detection, analysis, and recognition is an important capability for artificial intelligence (AI) solutions. The Face cognitive service in Azure makes it easy integrate these capabilities into your applications.

value.title: Enhance your service availability and data locality by using Azure Traffic Manager
value.excerpt: Discover how Azure Traffic Manager provides DNS load balancing for your application to improve the performance and availability of your application.

value.title: Get started with Go
value.excerpt: Take your first steps with Go.

value.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure
value.excerpt: Respond to incidents and activities in your infrastructure through alerting capabilities in Azure Monitor.

value.title: Introduction to Azure Kubernetes Service
value.excerpt: Get acquainted with the Azure Kubernetes open-source container-orchestration system for automating application deployment, scaling, and management.

value.title: Introduction to Kubernetes
value.excerpt: Get acquainted with the Kubernetes open-source container-orchestration system for automating application deployment, scaling, and management.

value.title: Introduction to Python
value.excerpt: Learn about the Python programming language, how to execute statements and scripts, declare variables, and create a basic Python app.

value.title: Monitor, diagnose, and troubleshoot your Azure storage
value.excerpt: Monitor, diagnose, and troubleshoot your Azure storage

value.title: Query relational data in Azure
value.excerpt: Query relational data in Azure

value.title: Build serverless APIs with Azure Functions | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jeff Hollan joins Scott Hanselman to show how you can build highly scalable serverless APIs with Azure Functions.  0:00 – Overview 1:09 – What "serverless" really means 4:00 – A closer look at Azure Functions 7:29 – Azure Functions Live Metrics 10:45 – Thinking downstream of Azure Functions 13:52 – Using

value.title: How to choose which services to use in Azure | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: In this video, Azure MVP Barry Luijbregts chats with Scott Hanselman about how he goes about choosing the right services in Azure to run his applications and store his data.   For more information, see:  • Overview of Azure services https://aka.ms/azfr/435/01  • Pluralsight course: Microsoft Azure for

value.title: Introducing new Azure API Management capabilities | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Miao Jiang joins Scott Hanselman discuss the API economy and how companies must master the challenges inherent in building, maintaining, managing, and exposing APIs to participate. That's where Azure API Management can help. Azure API Management is a solution for publishing APIs to external and internal
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/f7CJphbEmk4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Build a scalable application with virtual machine scale sets
value.excerpt: Enable your application to automatically adjust to changes in load while minimizing costs with virtual machine scale sets.

value.title: Create a classification model with Azure Machine Learning designer
value.excerpt: Classification is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict categories or classes. Learn how to create classification models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

value.title: Deploy Azure virtual machines from VHD templates
value.excerpt: Standardize and automate your virtual machine deployments to minimize manual configuration, variance, and error.

value.title: Keep your virtual machines updated
value.excerpt: Learn to use Azure Update Management to update virtual machines, verify agent connectivity, and use Azure Log Analytics in your cloud environment.
